description.narrative: Funding under this initiative is to support the Department of Health and Ageing to manage funds to support the Ministry of Health in Tuvalu implement Tuvalu's National Oral Health Survey. This initiative will contribute to fulfilling the Long-term Milestones 2015 of the Te Kakeega II Strategic Area 3 to “ secure respectable health standard for Tuvaluans” and progress toward accomplishing the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) 4, “ to reduce child mortality” and Goal 5 “ to improve maternal health”. The Ministry of Health in Tuvalu started working with the Australian Research Centre for Health Population Oral Health (ARCPOH) to develop questionnaires and samples for a national survey on oral health in Tuvalu. The survey will provide critical information on the status of oral health in Tuvalu through the data collected from this national survey. The analysis of the surveyed data will inform how the Ministry of Health in Tuvalu determines disease distribution and severity of oral health
